item.title: Hash Functions
item.author: 佘崧林
item.description: Overview A hash function h(x) is a map from n bits to m bits where m<n An output of a hash function is called a message digest or a hash value. A hash function should satisfy the following property: Collision resistance. Second pre-image resistance. Given x, if the probability to find $$y \not= x $$ such that $$h(y) = h(x)$$ is negligible, then the function h is called second pre-image
